events.name: Halo's Career Development training

venue.name: Sri Lanka Institute of Information Technology (Malabe)

events.description:
• Thank you for your interest in Halo's Career Development training! Our workshop, held in partnership with Women Techmakers Sri Lanka, is focused on providing career development training to women in technology. 

• Please note that the event will be conducted in English. 

• The event is currently scheduled to be held on Sunday October 8, 2017 from 9:00 to 12:30 p.m. in Colombo, Sri Lanka at the Sri Lanka Institute of Information Technology. 

• Upon registration, we'll provide a more detailed update including the Hall Number where the session will be held.

Hurry up and get yourself registered from here - https://goo.gl/forms/ixQCLKc9Oedvd40w1

events.name: Girls’ Coding Bootcamp

venue.name: University of Colombo School of Computing

events.description:
Understanding of programing languages and being able to present information in the digital format over the internet is a must required skill. Although many university students get privilege to  learn basic skills in web development, not many students in schools get a chance to learn the skills in a practical environment. Among that, very less percentage of female school students get a chance to get inspired and learn from female role models in the country who can help them to fill the skill gap.

Girls’ Coding Bootcamp is a collaborative project by Women Techmakers Sri Lanka chapter and IEEE Women in Engineering Sri Lanka section to address the above challenge.

(Only For Girls)

events.name: Mobile Sites certification Facilitator Training Program (invite-only)
events.description: Many people learn better when they learn in groups. Study Jams are community-run study groups for developers covering a range of Google Developers content. Typically, Study Jams focus on completing a course, but some may focus on mastering a skill or product area.

events.name: Mobile Web/Sites Certification Study Jams (Women Only)

venue.name: University of Colombo School of Computing

events.description:
• What we'll do
Google's Mobile Web/Sites Certification Study Jam is a professional accreditation that Google offers to individuals who demonstrate understanding in basic and advanced aspects of mobile website design and development.There will be in-person sessions and then followed by multiple choice exam. Training participants will gain specific skill they can use for career advancement or personal development. Participants that complete the exam receive a printable certificate to verify status as certified mobile sites professional and a Google Partners public profile page listing the certification.

• What to bring
Today Mobile now accounts for over half of all web traffic. Users expect their small-screen experiences to be as quick and intuitive as those on desktop. But making the mobile web fast and easy takes some special skills. 53% of mobile visitors will leave if the page takes more than three seconds to load. The average page takes 22 seconds to load, so collectively we're losing a lot of mobile users and giving them a bad experience along the way. Speed is only one part of the picture when creating

• Important to know
Register here :- http://rsvp.lk/gdgsrilanka/mobile-web-study-jam

events.name: Mobile Sites certification Study Jam (University of Colombo School of Computing)

venue.name: University of Colombo School of Computing

events.description:
• What we'll do
This is a google certification assessment programme regarding mobile sites certification which covers the basic and advanced concepts, including best practices for creating, managing, measuring, and optimizing mobile websites.
It is recommended for the participants to have basic knowledge on following areas,
HTML
CSS
PHP
Passing this assessment demonstrates a strong knowledge of mobile sites design, and an understanding of best practices and current browser technologies.
• What to bring
Bringing in laptops are not needed and meals will NOT be provided. The applicants who will be invited for the event are advised to be presented at the event to avoid being low prioritized from future events.
• Important to know
Register here
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdvgbPYSgA7sFDGr9pQGBgwp-Aj8nkOrjcdq2TDxF3RkQeY2Q/viewform

events.name: Flutter Study Jam
events.description:
Work with Google instructors step-by-step to build a fully functional native “Unit Converter App” for both iOS and Android using Flutter
Learn how to set up your environment and start building your first Flutter application
Learn about fundamentals: UI Widgets, App State, Material Design, User Interaction and Gestures, and Packages
Learn how to structure and architect your app and use Flutter's tooling to build apps efficiently
Complete the course and get Google-offered Study Jam completion certificate and a profile badge.

events.name: Global Game Jam : Sri Lanka
events.description:
Details
* 48 hours non-stop Game Development event.
* First ever Global Game Jam site in Sri Lanka.
* The event is for newbies and experts who like to Develop Games.

Innovation - Experimentation - Collaboration

The Global Game Jam® (GGJ) is the world's largest game jam event (game creation) taking place around the world at physical locations. Think of it as a hackathon focused on game development. It is the growth of an idea that in today’s heavily connected world, we could come together, be creative, share experiences and express ourselves in a multitude of ways using video games – it is very universal. The weekend stirs a global creative buzz in games, while at the same time exploring the process of development, be it programming, iterative design, narrative exploration or artistic expression. It is all condensed into a 48 hour development cycle. The GGJ encourages people with all kinds of backgrounds to participate and contribute to this global spread of game development and creativity.

The structure of a jam is usually that everyone gathers on Friday late afternoon, watches a short video keynote with advice from leading game developers, and then a secret theme is announced. All sites worldwide are then challenged to make games based on that same theme, with games to be completed by Sunday afternoon. In January 2018, we had 803 locations in 108 countries create 8,606 games in one weekend! GGJ 2019 is January 25-27 at a location near you… if not you can make one of your own. The jam is known for helping foster new friendships, increase confidence and opportunities within the community. The jam is always an intellectual challenge. People are invited to explore new technology tools, trying on new roles in development and testing their skills to do something that requires them to design, develop create, test and make a new game in the time span of 48 hours.

The GGJ stimulates collaboration and is not a competition.
